00053 /*! The maximum storage length for a probe set name in the CDF file. */
00054 #define MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH 64
00055 
00056 /*! The storage length for integrity md5 (hex) in the CDF file. */
00057 #define INTEGRITY_MD5_LENGTH 32

00061 /*! Storage for the header in a CDF file. */
00062 class CCDFFileHeader
00063 {
00064 protected:
00065     /*! The magic number in an XDA file */
00066     int m_Magic;
00067 
00068     /*! The version number */
00069     int m_Version;
00070 
00071         /*! The GUID */
00072         std::string m_GUID;
00073 
00074         /*! The integrity md5 */
00075         std::string m_IntegrityMd5;
00076 
00077         /*! The chip type - array type name without version (only apply to XDA version 4 or above */
00078         std::string m_ChipType;
00079 
00080         /*! The array of chip types - all array type names with and without versions (only apply to XDA version 4 or above */
00081         std::vector<std::string> m_ChipTypes;
00082 
00083     /*! The number of probe sets defined in the file */
00084     int m_NumProbeSets;
00085 
00086     /*! The number of QC probe sets in the file */
00087     int m_NumQCProbeSets;
00088 
00089     /*! The reference sequence (used for resequencing arrays only) */
00090     std::string m_Reference;
00091 
00092     /*! The number of feature columns in the array */
00093     unsigned short m_Cols;
00094 
00095     /*! The number of feature rows in the array */
00096     unsigned short m_Rows;
00097 
00098     /*! Friend to the parent class */
00099     friend class CCDFFileData;
00100 
00101 public:
00102         /*! Get CDF Format Version
00103          * @return CDF Format Version
00104          */
00105         int GetFormatVersion() const { return m_Version; }
00106 
00107         /*! Get GUID
00108          * @return GUID
00109          */
00110         std::string GetGUID() const { return m_GUID; }
00111 
00112         /*! Get integrity md5
00113          * @return The integrity md5
00114          */
00115         std::string GetIntegrityMd5() const { return m_IntegrityMd5; }
00116 
00117         /*! Get chip type - array type name without version
00118          * @return The chip type.
00119          */
00120         std::string GetChipType() const { return m_ChipType; }
00121 
00122         /*! Get chip types - array type names with and without version
00123          * @return The chip types.
00124          */
00125         std::vector<std::string> GetChipTypes() const { return m_ChipTypes; }
00126 
00127         /*! Gets the number of feature columns in the array.
00128      * @return The number of columns.
00129      */
00130     int GetCols() const { return m_Cols; }
00131 
00132     /*! Gets the number of feature rows in the array.
00133      * @return The number of rows.
00134      */
00135     int GetRows() const { return m_Rows; }
00136 
00137     /*! Gets the number of probe sets.
00138      * @return The number of probe sets.
00139      */
00140     int GetNumProbeSets() const { return m_NumProbeSets; }
00141 
00142     /*! Gets the number of QC probe sets.
00143      * @return The number of QC probe sets.
00144      */
00145     int GetNumQCProbeSets() const { return m_NumQCProbeSets; }
00146 
00147     /*! Gets the reference sequence (for resequencing arrays only).
00148      * @return The reference sequence.
00149      */
00150     std::string &GetReference() { return m_Reference; }
00151 
00152     /*! Constructor */
00153     CCDFFileHeader();
00154 };

00158 /*! Defines the type of probe sets stored in the CDF file */
00159 enum GeneChipProbeSetType
00160 {
00161     /*! Unknown probe set */
00162     UnknownProbeSetType,
00163 
00164     /*! Expression probe set */
00165     ExpressionProbeSetType,
00166 
00167     /*! Genotyping probe set */
00168     GenotypingProbeSetType,
00169 
00170     /*! Resequencing probe set */
00171     ResequencingProbeSetType,
00172 
00173     /*! Tag probe set */
00174     TagProbeSetType,
00175 
00176     /*! Copy number probe set. */
00177     CopyNumberProbeSetType,
00178 
00179     /*! Genotype control probe set. */
00180     GenotypeControlProbeSetType,
00181 
00182     /*! Expression control probe set. */
00183     ExpressionControlProbeSetType,
00184 
00185     /*! Polymorphic marker probe set. */
00186     MarkerProbeSetType,
00187 
00188     /*! Multichannel marker probe set. */
00189     MultichannelMarkerProbeSetType
00190 };
00191 
00192 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00193 
00194 /*! Defines the direction of a probe set or group */
00195 enum DirectionType
00196 {
00197     /*! No direction specified */
00198     NoDirection,
00199 
00200     /*! Sense
00201      * All probes in the probe set (or probe group) have the sense direction
00202      */
00203     SenseDirection,
00204 
00205     /*! Anti sense
00206      * All probes in the probe set (or probe group) have the antisense direction
00207      */
00208     AntiSenseDirection,
00209 
00210     /* !Either
00211      * Some probes in the probe set (or probe group) have antisense direction,
00212      * others have sense direction
00213      */
00214     EitherDirection
00215 };
00216 
00217 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00218 
00219 /*! Defines the type of probe replication of a group   */
00220 enum ReplicationType
00221 {
00222     /*! Unspecified replication type */
00223     UnknownRepType,
00224 
00225     /*! Different
00226      * All probes in the probe group have different sequences
00227      */
00228     DifferentRepType,
00229 
00230     /*! Mixed
00231      * Some probes in the probe group have identical sequences
00232      */
00233     MixedRepType,
00234 
00235     /* Identical
00236      * All probes in the probe group have identical sequences
00237      */
00238     IdenticalRepType
00239 };

00243 /*! This class provides storage for an individual probe in a CDF file */
00244 class CCDFProbeInformation
00245 {
00246 protected:
00247     /*! The index of the probes probe pair or quartet (probe list). Also known as the atom position. */
00248     int m_ListIndex;
00249 
00250     /*! The expos value in the CDF file, this can either be a zero based index equal to the
00251      * list index or the exon position. */
00252     int m_Expos;
00253 
00254     /*! The X coordinate */
00255     unsigned short m_X;
00256 
00257     /*! The Y coordinate */
00258     unsigned short m_Y;
00259 
00260     /*! The probes base at the interrogation position */
00261     char m_PBase;
00262 
00263     /*! The targets base at the interrogation position */
00264     char m_TBase;
00265 
00266     /*! The probe length */
00267     unsigned short m_ProbeLength;
00268 
00269     /*! The probe grouping */
00270     unsigned short m_ProbeGrouping;
00271 
00272     /*! The probe identifier */
00273     int m_ProbeId;
00274 
00275     /*! Friend to the parent */
00276     friend class CCDFProbeGroupInformation;
00277 
00278     /*! Friend to the probe set */
00279     friend class CCDFProbeSetInformation;
00280 
00281     /*! Friend to the top level class */
00282     friend class CCDFFileData;
00283 
00284 public:
00285     /*! Returns the list index.
00286      * @return The list index.
00287      * This is an internal index used by Affymetrix chip design.
00288      */
00289     int GetListIndex() const { return m_ListIndex; }
00290 
00291     /*! Returns the expos value.
00292      * @return The expos value.
00293      * This is the position of the probe sequence in a longer sequence.  (Note
00294      * in some arrays this value may instead correspond to the GetListIndex value).
00295      * In expression arrays the longer sequence can be the sequence from which
00296      * the probe is selected.  In genotyping arrays the longer sequence can be
00297      * the sequence containing a polymorphic SNP.  More than one probe can have
00298      * the same expos value, e.g., in arrays containing perfect match/mismatch
00299      * pairs, both probes in the pair will have the same expos value.
00300      */
00301     int GetExpos() const { return m_Expos; }
00302 
00303     /*! Returns the X coordinate of the probe in the physical array.
00304      * @return The X coordinate.
00305      */
00306     int GetX() const { return m_X; }
00307 
00308     /*! Returns the Y coordinate of the probe in the physical array.
00309      * @return The Y coordinate.
00310      */
00311     int GetY() const { return m_Y; }
00312 
00313     /*! Returns the probes base at the interrogation position.
00314      * @return The probes base at the interrogation position.
00315      */
00316     char GetPBase() const { return m_PBase; }
00317 
00318     /*! Returns the targets base at the interrogation position.
00319      * @return The targets base at the interrogation position.
00320      */
00321     char GetTBase() const { return m_TBase; }
00322 
00323     /*! Returns the length of the probe.
00324      * @return The probe length.
00325      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00326      */
00327     unsigned short GetProbeLength() const { return m_ProbeLength; }
00328 
00329     /*! Returns the grouping of the probe in the physical array.
00330      * @return The probe grouping.
00331      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00332      */
00333     unsigned short GetProbeGrouping() const { return m_ProbeGrouping; }
00334 
00335     /*! Returns the unique probe identifier for probe sequence on the physical array.
00336      * @return The probe id.
00337      */
00338     int GetProbeId() const { return m_ProbeId; }
00339 
00340     /*! Constructor */
00341     CCDFProbeInformation();
00342 };
00343 
00344 /*! The size of the probe object as stored in the XDA CDF file version 1. */
00345 #define PROBE_SIZE (4+4+2+2+1+1)
00346 
00347 /*! The size of the probe object as stored in the XDA CDF file version 2, 3 and 4. */
00348 #define PROBE_SIZE_V2 (4+4+2+2+1+1+2+2)

00352 /*! This class provides storage for a group of probes, also known as a block. */
00353 class CCDFProbeGroupInformation
00354 {
00355 protected:
00356     /*! The number of probe pairs or probe quartets in the group. */
00357     int m_NumLists;
00358 
00359     /*! The number of probes in the group. */
00360     int m_NumCells;
00361 
00362     /*! The first probes list index value. */
00363     int m_Start;
00364 
00365     /*! The last probes list index value. */
00366     int m_Stop;
00367 
00368     /*! The probe set index associated with the group. */
00369     int m_ProbeSetIndex;
00370 
00371     /*! The group index. */
00372     int m_GroupIndex;
00373 
00374     /*! The name of the group. */
00375     std::string m_Name;
00376 
00377     /*! The wobble situation. */
00378     unsigned short m_WobbleSituation;
00379 
00380     /*! The allele code. */
00381     unsigned short m_AlleleCode;
00382 
00383     /*! The channel. */
00384     unsigned char m_Channel;
00385 
00386     /*! The probe replication type. */
00387     unsigned char m_RepType;
00388 
00389     /*! The number of cells per list (1 or 2 for expression and genotyping, 4 for resequencing). */
00390     unsigned char m_NumCellsPerList;
00391 
00392     /*! The direction of the target that the probes are interrogating. */
00393     unsigned char m_Direction;
00394 
00395     /*! The probes in the group */
00396     std::vector<CCDFProbeInformation> m_Cells;
00397 
00398     /*! A pointer to the probes. This is used when memory mapping is used. */
00399     std::vector<CCDFProbeInformation> *m_pCells;
00400 
00401     /*! Friend to the parent class. */
00402     friend class CCDFProbeSetInformation;
00403 
00404     /*! Friend to the top level class. */
00405     friend class CCDFFileData;
00406 
00407     /*! Copies the data in the input object to the member variables.
00408      * @param orig The group to copy.
00409      */
00410     void MakeShallowCopy(CCDFProbeGroupInformation &orig);
00411 
00412 public:
00413     /*! Gets the groups direction.
00414      * @return The groups direction.
00415      * See the DirectionType enumeration for details
00416      */
00417     DirectionType GetDirection() const { return (DirectionType)m_Direction; }
00418 
00419     /*! Gets the number of lists (atoms) in the group.
00420      * @return The number of lists (atoms) in the group.
00421      * In expression and genotyping arrays probes may be arranged in singletons or paired
00422      * with a mismatch probe. In resequencing arrays probes may be arranged in quartes.
00423      * Note that multiple arrangements may be present on the same
00424      * array, but not within a probe group (or probe set).
00425      * Each such singleton or pair or quartet is a "list" or "atom."
00426      */
00427     int GetNumLists() const { return m_NumLists; }
00428 
00429     /*! Gets the number of probes in the group.
00430      * @return The number of probes in the group.
00431      */
00432     int GetNumCells() const { return m_NumCells; }
00433 
00434     /*! Gets the number of probes per list.
00435      * @return The number of probes per list.
00436      * Always constant within a probe group or probe set.
00437      */
00438     int GetNumCellsPerList() const { return (int)m_NumCellsPerList; }
00439 
00440     /*! Gets the start list index value.
00441      * @return The start list index value.
00442      * This is the minimum value returned by GetListIndex()
00443      * This is an internal index used by Affymetrix chip design.
00444      */
00445     int GetStart() const { return m_Start; }
00446 
00447     /*! Gets the stop list index value.
00448      * @return The stop list index value.
00449      * This is the maximum value returned by GetListIndex()
00450      * This is an internal index used by Affymetrix chip design.
00451      */
00452     int GetStop() const { return m_Stop; }
00453 
00454     /*! Gets the group name.
00455      * @return The group name.
00456      */
00457     std::string GetName() { return m_Name; }
00458 
00459     /*! Gets the wobble situation.
00460      * @return The wobble situation.
00461      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00462      */
00463     unsigned short GetWobbleSituation() const { return m_WobbleSituation; }
00464 
00465     /*! Gets the allele code.
00466      * @return The allele code.
00467      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1.
00468      */
00469     unsigned short GetAlleleCode() const { return m_AlleleCode; }
00470 
00471     /*! Gets the channel.
00472      * @return The channel.
00473      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1 and 2.
00474      */
00475     unsigned char GetChannel() const { return m_Channel; }
00476 
00477     /*! Gets the probe replication type.
00478      * @return The probe replication type.
00479      * See the ReplicationType enumeration for details
00480      * This is not applicable to XDA CDF file version 1 and 2.
00481      */
00482     ReplicationType GetRepType() const { return (ReplicationType) m_RepType; }
00483 
00484     /*! Retrieves the probe object given a zero-based index.
00485      * @param cell_index zero-based index in the probe group to the probe of interest.
00486      * @param info The returned probe data.
00487      * Note: this has nothing to do with list index returned by GetListIndex
00488      */
00489     void GetCell(int cell_index, CCDFProbeInformation & info);
00490 
00491     /*! Constructor */
00492     CCDFProbeGroupInformation();
00493 
00494     /*! Destructor */
00495     ~CCDFProbeGroupInformation();
00496 };
00497 
00498 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file version 1. */
00499 #define PROBE_GROUP_SIZE (MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH+4+4+4+4+1+1)
00500 
00501 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file version 2. */
00502 #define PROBE_GROUP_SIZE_V2 (MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH+4+4+4+4+1+1+2+2)
00503 
00504 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file version 3 and 4. */
00505 #define PROBE_GROUP_SIZE_V3 (MAX_PROBE_SET_NAME_LENGTH+4+4+4+4+1+1+2+2+1+1)

00509 /*! This class provides storage for a probe set. */
00510 class CCDFProbeSetInformation
00511 {
00512 protected:
00513     /*! The number of lists (atoms) in the probe set. */
00514     int m_NumLists;
00515 
00516     /*! The number of groups (blocks) in the probe set. */
00517     int m_NumGroups;
00518 
00519     /*! The number of probes in the set. */
00520     int m_NumCells;
00521 
00522     /*! An index for the probe set.*/
00523     int m_Index;
00524 
00525     /*! An arbitrary number assigned to the probe set. */
00526     int m_ProbeSetNumber;
00527 
00528     /*! The type of probe set. */
00529     unsigned short m_ProbeSetType;
00530 
00531     /*! The direction of the target that the probes are interrogating. */
00532     unsigned char m_Direction;
00533 
00534     /*! The number of probes per list. */
00535     unsigned char m_NumCellsPerList;
00536 
00537     /*! The groups in the set. */
00538     std::vector<CCDFProbeGroupInformation> m_Groups;
00539 
00540     /*! A pointer to the groups. This is used when memory mapping is used. */
00541     std::vector<CCDFProbeGroupInformation> *m_pGroups;
00542 
00543     /*! Friend to the top level class. */
00544     friend class CCDFFileData;
00545 
00546     /*! Copies the data in the input object to the member variables.
00547      * @param orig The probe set to copy.
00548      */
00549     void MakeShallowCopy(CCDFProbeSetInformation &orig);
00550 
00551 public:
00552     /*! Gets the probe set type.
00553      * @return The probe set type.
00554      * see GeneChipProbeSetType for details
00555      */
00556     GeneChipProbeSetType GetProbeSetType() const { return (GeneChipProbeSetType)m_ProbeSetType; }
00557 
00558     /*! Gets the probe sets direction.
00559      * @return The probe sets direction.
00560      * See the DirectionType enumeration for details
00561      */
00562     DirectionType GetDirection() const { return (DirectionType)m_Direction; }
00563 
00564     /*! Gets the number of lists (atoms) in the set.
00565      * @return The number of lists (atoms) in the set.
00566      * See GetNumLists for probe group for details
00567      */
00568     int GetNumLists() const { return m_NumLists; }
00569 
00570     /*! The number of groups in the set.
00571      * @return The number of groups in the set.
00572      * In genotyping arrays it is convenient to group organize probes that interrogate
00573      * a polymorphic SNP into subsets that interrogate a particular allele and have
00574      * the same direction (i.e., sense or antisense).  Each grouping is a "probe group."
00575      * Affymetrix also uses the term "block" for a "probe group."
00576      */
00577     int GetNumGroups() const { return m_NumGroups; }
00578 
00579     /*! The number of probes in the set.
00580      * @return The number of probes in the set.
00581      */
00582     int GetNumCells() const { return m_NumCells; }
00583 
00584     /*! Gets the number of probes per list.
00585      * @return The number of probes per list.
00586      * Always constant within a probe group or probe set.
00587      */
00588     int GetNumCellsPerList() const { return (int)m_NumCellsPerList; }
00589 
00590     /*! Gets the probe set number.
00591      * @return The probe set number.
00592      * This is an internal value (unit number) used by Affymetrix chip design.
00593      */
00594     int GetProbeSetNumber() const { return m_ProbeSetNumber; }
00595 
00596     /*! Gets a group object.
00597      * @param index The index to the group of interest.
00598      * @param info The returned group data.
00599      */
00600     void GetGroupInformation(int index, CCDFProbeGroupInformation & info);
00601 
00602     /*! Constructor */
00603     CCDFProbeSetInformation();
00604 
00605     /*! Destructor */
00606     ~CCDFProbeSetInformation();
00607 };
00608 
00609 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file. */
00610 #define PROBE_SET_SIZE (4+4+4+4+2+1+1)

00614 /*! This class provides storage for the list of probe set names. */
00615 class CCDFProbeSetNames
00616 {
00617 public:
00618     /*! Friend to the top level class. */
00619     friend class CCDFFileData;
00620 
00621     /*! Constructor */
00622     CCDFProbeSetNames();
00623 
00624     /*! Destructor */
00625     ~CCDFProbeSetNames();
00626 
00627     /*! Deallocates memory used by the class. */
00628     void Clear();
00629 
00630 protected:
00631 
00632     /*! Array of probe set names, used if not memory mapping. */
00633     std::vector<std::string> m_ProbeSetNames;
00634 
00635     /*! Resizes the probe set name array. */
00636     void Resize(int size);
00637 
00638     /*! Stores the name of the probe set in the internal array. */
00639     void SetName(int index, std::string name);
00640 
00641 public:
00642     /*! Gets the probe set name.
00643      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set name of interest.
00644      * @return The name of the probe set.
00645      */
00646     std::string GetName(int index) const;
00647 };

00649 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00651 /*! This class provides storage for QC probes */
00652 class CCDFQCProbeInformation
00653 {
00654 public:
00655     /*! Constructor */
00656     CCDFQCProbeInformation();
00657 
00658 protected:
00659     /*! The X coordinate of the probe */
00660     unsigned short m_X;
00661 
00662     /*! The Y coordinate of the probe */
00663     unsigned short m_Y;
00664 
00665     /*! The probe length. This value may be 1 for non-synthesized features */
00666     unsigned char m_PLen;
00667 
00668     /*! Flag indicating if the probe is a perfect match probe. */
00669     unsigned char m_PMProbe;
00670 
00671     /*! Flag indicating if the probe is used for background calculations (blank feature). */
00672     unsigned char m_Background;
00673 
00674     /*! Friend to the parent class */
00675     friend class CCDFQCProbeSetInformation;
00676 
00677     /*! Friend to the top level CDF class */
00678     friend class CCDFFileData;
00679 
00680 public:
00681     /*! Gets the X coordinate of the probe.
00682      * @return The X coordinate.
00683      */
00684     int GetX() const { return m_X; }
00685 
00686     /*! Gets the Y cooridnate of the probe.
00687      * @return The Y coordinate.
00688      */
00689     int GetY() const { return m_Y; }
00690 
00691     /*! Gets the probe length.
00692      * @return The probe length. This value may be 1 for non-synthesized features.
00693      */
00694     int GetPLen() const { return m_PLen; }
00695 
00696     /*! Gets the flag indicating if the probe is a perfect match probe.
00697      * @return The flag indicating if the probe is a perfect match probe
00698      */
00699     bool IsPerfectMatchProbe() const { return (m_PMProbe == 1 ? true : false); }
00700 
00701     /*! Gets a flag indicating if the probe is used for background calculations (blank feature).
00702      * @return Flag indicating if the probe is used for background calculations (blank feature).
00703      */
00704     bool IsBackgroundProbe() const { return (m_Background == 1 ? true : false); }
00705 };

00707 /*! This is the size of the object in a binary CDF file. */
00708 #define QC_PROBE_SIZE (2+2+1+1+1)
00709 
00710 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00711 
00712 /*! The type of QC probe set */
00713 enum GeneChipQCProbeSetType
00714 {
00715     /*! Unknown probe set */
00716     UnknownQCProbeSetType,
00717 
00718     /*! Probes used for the checker board patterns for antisense arrays. */
00719     CheckerboardNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00720 
00721     /*! Probes used for the checker board patterns for sense arrays. */
00722     CheckerboardPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00723 
00724     /*! Hybridization control probes for antisense arrays. */
00725     HybNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00726 
00727     /*! Hybridization control probes for sense arrays. */
00728     HybPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00729 
00730     /*! Probes used for text patterns for antisense arrays. */
00731     TextFeaturesNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00732 
00733     /*! Probes used for text patterns for sense arrays. */
00734     TextFeaturesPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00735 
00736     /*! Central probes for antisense arrays. */
00737     CentralNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00738 
00739     /*! Central probes for sense arrays. */
00740     CentralPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00741 
00742     /*! Gene expression control probes for antisense arrays. */
00743     GeneExpNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00744 
00745     /*! Gene expression control probes for sense arrays. */
00746     GeneExpPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00747 
00748     /*! Cycle fidelity probes for antisense arrays. */
00749     CycleFidelityNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00750 
00751     /*! Cycle fidelity probes for sense arrays. */
00752     CycleFidelityPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00753 
00754     /*! Central cross probes for antisense arrays. */
00755     CentralCrossNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00756 
00757     /*! Central cross probes for sense arrays. */
00758     CentralCrossPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00759 
00760     /*! X-hyb control probes for antisense arrays. */
00761     CrossHybNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00762 
00763     /*! X-hyb control probes for sense arrays. */
00764     CrossHybPositiveQCProbeSetType,
00765 
00766     /*! Space normalization probes for antisense arrays. */
00767     SpatialNormalizationNegativeQCProbeSetType,
00768 
00769     /*! Space normalization probes for sense arrays. */
00770     SpatialNormalizationPositiveQCProbeSetType
00771 };

00775 /*! This class provides storage for the probes in a QC probe set. */
00776 class CCDFQCProbeSetInformation
00777 {
00778 protected:
00779     /*! The number of probes in the set. */
00780     int m_NumCells;
00781 
00782     /*! The type of QC probes. */
00783     unsigned short m_QCProbeSetType;
00784 
00785     /*! The array of probes. */
00786     std::vector<CCDFQCProbeInformation> m_Cells;
00787 
00788     /*! The array of probes. */
00789     std::vector<CCDFQCProbeInformation> *m_pCells;
00790 
00791     /*! Friend to the top level CDF class. */
00792     friend class CCDFFileData;
00793 
00794     /*! Copies the data in the input object to the member variables.
00795      * @param orig The probe set to copy.
00796      */
00797     void MakeShallowCopy(CCDFQCProbeSetInformation &orig);
00798 
00799 public:
00800     /*! Gets the probe set type.
00801      * @return The probe set type.
00802      */
00803     GeneChipQCProbeSetType GetQCProbeSetType() const { return (GeneChipQCProbeSetType)m_QCProbeSetType; }
00804 
00805     /*! Gets the number of probes in the set.
00806      * @return The number of probes in the set.
00807      */
00808     int GetNumCells() const { return m_NumCells; }
00809 
00810     /*! Gets the information about a single probe in the set.
00811      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe of interest.
00812      * @param info The information about the probe.
00813      */
00814     void GetProbeInformation(int index, CCDFQCProbeInformation & info);
00815 
00816     /*! Constructor */
00817     CCDFQCProbeSetInformation();
00818 
00819     /*! Destructor */
00820     ~CCDFQCProbeSetInformation();
00821 };

00823 /*! This is the size of the QC probe set object in a binary CDF file. */
00824 #define QC_PROBE_SET_SIZE (4+2)

00828 /*! This class provides storage and reading capabilities for a CDF file. */
00829 class CCDFFileData
00830 {
00831 protected:
00832     /*! The position of the probe set names in the XDA file. */
00833     std::ios::pos_type probeSetNamePos;
00834 
00835     /*! The position of the QC probe set index array in the XDA file. */
00836     std::ios::pos_type qcSetIndexPos;
00837 
00838     /*! The position of the probe set index array in the XDA file. */
00839     std::ios::pos_type probeSetIndexPos;
00840 
00841     /*! What was the last probesetindex read?
00842      *  This state allows us to handle sequential reads quickly. (no seeking.)
00843      */
00844     uint32_t m_probeSetIndex_last;
00845 
00846     /*! 1 if like m_probeSetIndex_last is valid.
00847      *  The seekg method clears this.
00848      */
00849     uint32_t m_probeSetIndex_last_valid;
00850 
00851     /*! Use this seekg method when seeking with the iteratorReader.
00852      *  It updates the state needed for sequenial reads.
00853      */
00854     void seekg(uint32_t pos, const std::ios_base::seekdir& dir)
00855     {
00856         // invalidate the last probe state
00857         m_probeSetIndex_last_valid=0;
00858         // m_probeSetIndex_last=0; // we dont need to clear this as we just cleared "_valid"
00859         // and do the seek
00860         iteratorReader.seekg(pos,dir);
00861     }
00862 
00863     /*! The file stream for the probe set information iterator. */
00864     std::ifstream iteratorReader;
00865 
00866     /*! Flag to indicate that only the header part of the file is to be read. */
00867     bool readHeaderOnly;
00868 
00869     /*! The file header object. */
00870     CCDFFileHeader m_Header;
00871 
00872     /*! The list of probe set names. */
00873     CCDFProbeSetNames m_ProbeSetNames;
00874 
00875     /*! An array of probe sets. */
00876     std::vector<CCDFProbeSetInformation> m_ProbeSets;
00877 
00878     /*! An array of QC probe sets. */
00879     std::vector<CCDFQCProbeSetInformation> m_QCProbeSets;
00880 
00881     /*! The CDF file name (full path). */
00882     std::string m_FileName;
00883 
00884     /*! A string to hold an error message upon read failures. */
00885     std::string m_strError;
00886 
00887     /*! Opens the file for reading.
00888      * @return True if successful.
00889      */
00890     bool Open();
00891 
00892     /*! Reads a text format CDF file.
00893      * @return True if successful.
00894      */
00895     bool ReadTextFormat();
00896 
00897     /*! Reads an XDA format CDF file.
00898      * @return True if successful.
00899      */
00900     bool ReadXDAFormat();
00901 
00902     /*! Reads the header of an XDA format CDF file.
00903      * @return True if successful.
00904      */
00905     bool ReadXDAHeader();
00906 
00907 public:
00908     /*! Sets the name of the file.
00909      * @param name The full path of the CDF file.
00910      */
00911     void SetFileName(const char *name) { m_FileName = name; }
00912 
00913     /*! Gets the name of the file.
00914      * @return The full path of the CDF file.
00915      */
00916     std::string GetFileName() const { return m_FileName; }
00917 
00918     /*! Gets the header object.
00919      * @return The CDF file header object.
00920      */
00921     CCDFFileHeader &GetHeader() { return m_Header; }
00922 
00923         /*! Get GUID
00924          * @return GUID
00925          */
00926         std::string GetGUID();
00927 
00928         /*! Get integrity md5
00929          * @return The integrity md5
00930          */
00931         std::string GetIntegrityMd5();
00932 
00933         /*! Gets the error string.
00934      * @return A string describing the last read error.
00935      */
00936     std::string GetError() const { return m_strError; }
00937 
00938     /*! Gets the name of a probe set.
00939      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set name of interest.
00940      * @return The probe set name.
00941      */
00942     std::string GetProbeSetName(int index);
00943 
00944     /*! Gets the chip type (probe array type) of the CDF file.
00945      * @return The chip type. This is just the name (without extension) of the CDF file.
00946      */
00947     std::string GetChipType();
00948 
00949     /*! Gets the chip types (probe array type) of the CDF file. Allow substrings deliminated by '.'
00950      * @return vector of chip types
00951      */
00952     std::vector<std::string> GetChipTypes();
00953 
00954     /*! Reads the entire file.
00955      * @return True if successful.
00956      */
00957     bool Read();
00958 
00959     /*! Reads the header of the file only.
00960      * @return True if successful.
00961      */
00962     bool ReadHeader();
00963 
00964     /*! Checks the version number for binary/text CDF.
00965      * @return True if successful.
00966      */
00967     bool IsCdfVersion(int iVersion) { return (m_Header.GetFormatVersion() == iVersion); }
00968     bool IsMinCdfVersion(int iVersion) { return (m_Header.GetFormatVersion() >= iVersion); }
00969     bool IsMaxCdfVersion(int iVersion) { return (m_Header.GetFormatVersion() <= iVersion); }
00970     bool IsGcVersion(double dVersion) { return (m_Header.GetFormatVersion() == (int)dVersion); }
00971     bool IsMinGcVersion(double dVersion) { return (m_Header.GetFormatVersion() >= (int)dVersion); }
00972     bool IsMaxGcVersion(double dVersion) { return (m_Header.GetFormatVersion() <= (int)dVersion); }
00973 
00974     /*! Checks if the file exists.
00975      * @return True if the file exists.
00976      */
00977     bool Exists();
00978 
00979     /*! Deallocates memory and closes any file handles. */
00980     void Close();
00981 
00982     /*! Determines if a CDF file is of the XDA (binary) format.
00983      * @return True if XDA format.
00984      */
00985     bool IsXDACompatibleFile();
00986 
00987     /*! Gets the probe set type for non-qc probe sets.
00988      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set of interest.
00989      * @return The type of probe set.
00990      */
00991     GeneChipProbeSetType GetProbeSetType(int index);
00992 
00993     /*! Gets the probe set information.
00994      * @param index The zero-based index to the probe set of interest.
00995      * @param info The probe set information.
00996      * @return The probe set information.
00997      */
00998     void GetProbeSetInformation(int index, CCDFProbeSetInformation & info);
00999 
01000     /*! Gets the QC probe set information by index.
01001      * @param index The zero-based index to the QC probe set of interest.
01002      * @param info The QC probe set information.
01003      * @return The QC probe set information.
01004      */
01005     void GetQCProbeSetInformation(int index, CCDFQCProbeSetInformation & info);
01006 
01007     /*! Gets the QC probe set information by type.
01008      * @param qcType The type of QC probe set to retrieve.
01009      * @param info The QC probe set information.
01010      * @return The QC probe set information.
01011      */
01012     void GetQCProbeSetInformation(GeneChipQCProbeSetType qcType, CCDFQCProbeSetInformation & info);
01013 
01014     /*! Constructor */
01015     CCDFFileData();
01016 
01017     /*! Destructor */
01018     ~CCDFFileData();
01019 };
